result.execSummary:
The defendant Emily J Jarvis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 16 days are granted if imposed.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Paid in full.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Oconomowoc Police Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended. Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed. Defendant to obtain trauma informed care.

Follow through with Mental Health treatment / counseling Not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Emily J Jarvis in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph J. Dorlack.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED.  Credit for 16 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation
- 24 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 24 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- There is $2,500.00 cash posted in this matter.  Poster to contact the court within 1 week to advise whether the money should be applied to fines and costs in this matter and in 14CF926 or if it should be refunded.
- Fine of $1,973.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Oconomowoc Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of Probation:  Defendant not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid license.  Follow through with Mental Health treatment/counseling.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Defendant to obtain trauma informed care.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
CONDITION TIME: 6 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence FORTHWITH.

Attorney Joseph J. Dorlack in court.   Defendant Emily J Jarvis did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 2:02 - scheduled for 1:30.  Court orders capias STAYED until August 15, 2014 at 12:00 pm.

COURT REMOVES THE SCRAM MONITORING REQUIREMENT. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN AS PREVIOUSLY SET AS FOLLOWS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program. Defendant to post $2500.00 cash and sign a co-signed bond for $10,000.00 with 1 parent (Peter or Linda). If the co-sign bond is not signed the defendant to post the original $20,000.00 cash.

Defendant Emily J Jarvis in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph J. Dorlack.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests all witnesses be excluded from the Courtroom. Court grants the request. Officer Timothy P. from the Town of Oconomowoc was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit #1, marked. Cross examination by the defense. Officer Jeffrey S. from the Town of Oconomowoc was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Exhibit #1 is received. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State does not object to the defendant having huber bailee status, but feels some cash should be imposed. Court grants the motion to modify.  Arraignment scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Attorney Dorlack
Preliminary hearing on July 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.
